title: Stone Carved
content:
Hi there, can anyone direct me to threads on stone carved lettering or suggest any typefaces that may stem from this discipline?

thanks in advance.

 [‹ Magazine Design Inspiration?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071012080620/http:/typophile.com/node/18417 "Go to previous forum topic") [The NY Times: Oscar's Acceptance Speech Statistics ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071012080620/http:/typophile.com/node/18375 "Go to next forum topic")
author: R27

comments.content: [This typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20071012080620/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/ye-olde-block-nf/ye-olde-block-nf/) was based on incised lettering from sixteenth-century England, although the medium was wood...

Eric Gill’s work; he started as a stone cutter. Most of his typefaces derive from the alphabets he learned from stonecarving teachers.

Perpetua, Joanna, Aries, Golden Cockerel

Michael Harvey also has done a lot of carved lettering, as well as a bunch of very nice lapidary typefaces. One of Michael’s other major influences is his prolific work as a letterer for book covers, so his typefaces reflect this as much as they reflect his stonecarving work.

Strayhorn, Mezz, Ellington, Andreas

The most obvious is [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20071012080620/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.420.0.0), but here are a few that are less so:
